definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: The New York magazine is no stranger to controversial covers.
sentences.chinese: 纽约杂志对争议性封面司空见惯。

sentences.english: Gratuity is customary in this money-mad metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 在这个金钱至上的都市里，给小费是司空见惯的。

sentences.english: Gratuity is customary in this money-mad  metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 在这个金钱至上的大都市里，给小费是司空见惯的。

sentences.english: Job-hopping is a very common thing.
sentences.chinese: 眺槽是一件司空见惯的事。

sentences.english: Kenworth trucks are a common sight on major highways and interstates.
sentences.chinese: 肯沃斯卡车是对主要公路和州际公路司空见惯。

sentences.english: These are services we're used to on the PC.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是在电脑上已经司空见惯的服务。

sentences.english: Pirating used to be commonplace in this country.
sentences.chinese: 在这个国家，非法翻印曾经是司空见惯的。

sentences.english: Such scenes could become more common sights in the UK. Photograph: Peter Macdiarmid/Getty Images
sentences.chinese: 如此场面可能会在英国变得司空见惯。

sentences.english: "occupies the place" is in the university campus the commonly seen phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: “占座”是大学校园里司空见惯的现象。

sentences.english: Rebounds to the family are common between the ages of 18 to 22.
sentences.chinese: 在18至22之间又返回家庭这一现司空见惯。

sentences.english: This is not unusual for a small, family-run business.
sentences.chinese: 在家族企业里，这种现象是司空见惯了的。

sentences.english: In fact, it is not uncommon for a complete circular rainbow to be seen from an airplane.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，从飞机上看完整的圆虹霓是司空见惯的。

sentences.english: Passing the buck is a way of life in large bureaucracies.
sentences.chinese: 推卸责任是大官僚机构里司空见惯的事。

sentences.english: Nowadays there is nothing strange in a youngster writing verses.
sentences.chinese: 现在年青人写诗已是司空见惯。

sentences.english: The girls mill around. They are used to her tears by now.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在绕圈圈，她们对太婆流泪已司空见惯。

sentences.english: The detailed package inserts supplied with medicines have long been a familiar feature of pharmaceuticals.
sentences.chinese: 随药品附送的详细包装插页更是司空见惯。

definition: to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
